Edited June 2, 2018 by Cooly568

@Gameslinx @Galileo @Cooly568


Just wanted to say, count me in, having the same problem (LaunchSiteIndex - Argument Out Of Range ) but with GPP.... I removed dated quicksaves and kerbal konstructs, still after some specific actions the game is borked... can't save anymore, can't return to space center and so on... Made a demo video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eZXhf30HWjo  
Its a relatively fresh game - science mode, but with around 100 mods.
I wonder what messes around with the launch site list....  With Coolys information here it seems to be related to the Making History Expansion.
Do we have a workaround here?

BR
JebsSY

Was really bizarre, because removing Making History fixed it for me, give it a shot.
As I mentioned, I also had OPM installed, for even more planets! Removing that one helped for me.

2 hours ago, AmpCat said:

As I mentioned, I also had OPM installed, for even more planets! Removing that one helped for me.

Would make sense, you'd basically be pushing even a system with a healthy amount of RAM to the limit.

Version 3.4.0 

Updated to KSP 1.4.3

Please remember to check the README before installing.
Changes:

-Olei texture update and terrain improvements
-Gol overhaul
-Gullis overhaul
-Nievis complete overhaul
-Telos overhaul
-Niebos overhaul and atmosphere adjustments
-Terrain scatters added to most planets (trees on ocean worlds included)
-Glow-in-the-dark lava (If you install Kopernicus Expansion)
-Lava clouds updated on Gol and Nievis
-Biome maps for all updated bodies have been made accurate
-Switched cloud maps for Dreidos
-Removed Scorch clouds as its temperature is too high
-Extensive terrain texture improvements on the home system, plus Dreidiss, Niebos and Telos
-New accretion disk for Olu'um (Credit to Galileo88 for providing a texture to work with)
-Lowered cloud height on Sonus
-Updated terrain textures for Sojos and fixed invalid file paths
-Added GPO specific terrain settings in the main menu (Terrain quality has three extra options)

In career mode I was told to Explorer Olu'um right after the orbiting mission, instead of fly by Gol.

Is it normal?

16 minutes ago, Iso-Polaris said:

In career mode I was told to Explorer Olu'um right after the orbiting mission, instead of fly by Gol

Yep it's a bug unfortunately. Can't be fixed. I even tried setting the contract weight to 0 but to no avail. Just ignore it i'm afraid.

16 minutes ago, Iso-Polaris said:

Would it be possible to run GPO 3.4.0 with in ksp 1.3.1?

Yep just use the older versions of the dependencies
YAY! Now I can finally update my game!

Edited June 4, 2018 by Gameslinx
CKAN says it not available but ive manually installed the mod and required ones and currently just loading up KSP
how do i change the terrain settings with GPO or is it the same as stock KSP?

6 minutes ago, JinxerH said:

how do i change the terrain settings with GPO or is it the same as stock KSP?

It's in the main menu settings -> terrain quality. All options say "high" (which is currently a Kopernicus thing), but the further left, the lower the quality. Further right is higher quality.

In the new gol biome, there's a 05,94 BUTAI label in the middle of lava sea, and there's a biome called LatLon.

Is is suppose to happen?

3 hours ago, Iso-Polaris said:

In the new gol biome, there's a 05,94 BUTAI label in the middle of lava sea, and there's a biome called LatLon.

Is is suppose to happen?

It's been there ever since Gol was first made. You sir, have found an easter egg

(Now figure it out!)

If i use SVE and GPO together the clouds of Eve , Duna , Gaia and the other planets that are in the two EVE configs doesn't appear .
